content.question: ​The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3 x squared minus 2 x"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 6 x to the power of 4 plus 5 x cubed plus 3 x minus 5"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Which of the following statements is true about the remainder when <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is divided by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> ?

choices.label: ​The remainder is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>, so <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is a factor of <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>.

​​The remainder is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>, so <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is a factor of <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>.

​The remainder is <math alttext="open parentheses 7 x minus 5 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, so <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is not a factor of <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, and the graph of <math alttext="y equals fraction numerator f open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator g open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math> has a slant asymptote.

​The remainder is <math alttext="open parentheses 7 x minus 5 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, so <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is not a factor of  <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, and the graph of <math alttext="y equals fraction numerator f open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator g open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math> does not have a slant asymptote.

content.answer: ​The remainder is <math alttext="open parentheses 7 x minus 5 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, so <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is not a factor of  <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, and the graph of <math alttext="y equals fraction numerator f open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator g open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math> does not have a slant asymptote.

topic.text: 1.11: Equivalent Representations of Polynomial and Rational Expressions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
